document.title: INDIANA ACADEMIC STANDARDS World Languages American Sign Language: Secondary (ASL) 2019

E392CF9DEEAD43C3A221A380B7E3C38F.description:
I can create web sites and ASL vlogs that continue dialogue and
discussion about ASL and Deaf culture. (vlog = video blog)

B3CF85EEE51B46EEAD2C9A79D36C001E.description:
I can maintain a collection of books related to Deaf culture on topics of
personal interest.

DDE6717E4D4E4570B865A9C02C73A707.description:
I can travel to places of leisure and education that are significant to Deaf
community members.

0063B8171A9D467CB74BF1A840EB5C04.description:
I can continue to express and discuss their worldview through
participating in Deaf cultural events and conferences at local postsecondary
institutions.

07D3F7EEBF2A4322B59481C5AE32A34C.description: I can view and analyze major works of ASL literature and culture.

4DD6E16E6E904C9E91C6CE7168C39CB1.description: I can establish and/or maintain interpersonal relations with ASL users.

F106B78FE3044C199DB2BD08A4EA3147.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can use ASL both within and beyond the classroom to interact,
collaborate, and contribute in the Deaf community and the globalized world.

5D0AB8D1001C4D70B26AF0DB902409F8.description:
Lifelong Learning - Learners show evidence of becoming lifelong learners by
using American Sign Language for personal enjoyment and enrichment.

ADCA2394D95844CF933572737C6452E9.description:
I can present reports and provide information on stories, plays, films,
and current events to others through a variety of media in ASL.

5E1F31E6236948F5BB6C7DC776A3BAF7.description: I can actively participate in Deaf community events.

5FCAA89847404A4BA7FAFB03825D6276.description:
I can research various student exchange programs and/or opportunities to use
ASL around the world.

394C45E5DE3F41F686D315722F4062A2.description:
I can communicate with Deaf members in the community regarding personal,
vocational, professional interests or community and world concerns.

EDA3A27F274D492680B6BF5E9FA80539.description:
I can explore and explain careers that require proficiency in ASL and
knowledge of Deaf culture.

D79B9565DC6C4FB0B6B8865FB5635C23.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can use ASL both within and beyond the classroom to interact,
collaborate, and contribute in my community and the globalized world.

A3A143F2D8384EFE89235B32DA19EC7A.description:
School and Global - Learners use American Sign Language within and beyond
the school setting.

F5E4377ECAE640DC8D12307D7AF326B5.description:
Communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in
multilingual communities at home and around the world.

5F0E6D1CD62242F69807DE9756353BA7.description:
I can analyze and discuss the relationships between products and
perspectives in Deaf culture and contrast these with their own.

217D3AE160D648FDB7AC4DB93FC07D24.description:
I can investigate the unwritten rules present in society that impact
perceptions of Deaf people and Deaf culture.

0C6DB03DAD8F41FD9A1689623553A156.description:
I can compare thematically similar ASL and English films, television programs,
or texts, to identify specific cultural practices and perspectives.

E3064FA55F1B4BAFAE0E61114D913386.description:
I can compare the ways in which current events are covered in Deaf culture and
in their own culture’s press.

A4464287841A44ECBCC8DA1005E0CF81.description:
I can analyze the value and role collectivism plays in Deaf culture and
compare it with their own culture.

7FBF1CFE88F94477ABC338818856F92E.description:
I can analyze and compare controversial issues in the Deaf community and in
their own culture.

9605CC2EAC784D6D8D133B405F4FF453.description:
I can hypothesize about the relationship between perspectives and products in
Deaf culture and compare these with similar relationships from their own culture

DD97550375004EAC8E6D9F049305E388.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can explain, provide details about, and give specific examples of
differences and similarities between American Deaf culture, American Culture, and other signed
languages - countries’ cultures.

C404BE2B58B94B108CA1E689D2CC13AF.description:
Language Comparisons - Learners discuss the nature of language through
comparisons of American Sign Languages and other languages.

5631E25275F645858D41D07D97219BAD.description:
I can compare how ASL poetry, folk tales, jokes, and short stories to
reflect social issues and conflict.

4F6B02D8D7BB46F0B80380C2118D2808.description:
I can research and explain different communication styles influenced by
regional, gender, age, and educational differences to communicate messages in ASL
and other languages.

48DD889D7BDF4CDBA9139831F0DD0E63.description:
I can analyze and present elements of ASL, such as time, tense, and
aspect inflections, and comparable linguistic elements in English, and discuss how
languages use various forms to express particular meanings.

F42F42D1428746CD92A7FA8F5DE50AFB.description:
I can analyze and present language change and the historical
development of ASL and other languages.

1727DED95B76490EAAFB8D4F3890D780.description:
I can explain structural differences between the English and ASL
paragraph.

8D665BB4E69246C6944ED93213145211.description:
I can compare and explain the difficulties that ASL presents to English speakers
as well as the difficulties English presents to ASL users by analyzing and comparing linguistic
differences.

40F6C8842674422D9BA77F5F60C3B66C.description:
I can explain ASL principles of word order may differ from their own language
and hypothesize about how this may or may not reflect the ways in which Deaf culture
organizes information and views the world.

D63D7B573593459483439D029915BCE4.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can provide details about, and give specific examples of
differences and similarities between ASL, English, and other signed languages (from other countries).

381714BE3C054D88A998B369C92F458B.description:
Cultural Comparisons – Learners discuss the nature of culture through
comparisons of American Deaf culture, American culture, and other signed languages (countries’
cultures).

95592F6B65784D6085ACD84BB4EF3568.description:
Develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with
cultural competence.

8E8B6647B0294212AF50CE0862380CB1.description:
I can draw information from ASL sources to explain in live and recorded
formats with ASL users and other learners about topics relevant to their fields of study.

A9FB24842C0948059AD7BEE4DA3EA716.description: I can interview Deaf people to gain insights about social and cultural issues.

D2578C734E404CE9951382005262992A.description:
I can view, analyze, and explain literary and non-literary recorded
materials available only in ASL and comprehend the cultural messages embedded in
such texts.

97AA3F203E8F4B0284E19F6B76BDECE5.description:
I can discuss the distinctive viewpoint of protecting, cherishing, and taking
pride in ASL is a noted feature of Deaf culture.

49FEFE808B0B4BB6B5EB90BD79EC8544.description:
I can analyze and tell about the value and role of collectivism in Deaf
culture and contrast it with the predominant value of individualism in American
society.

D50FFC592B6441AAB7D93882B9562A68.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can access and evaluate in-depth information and perspectives
that are available through ASL and Deaf culture.

6774E04F332E4407BB025B2601009454.description:
Making Connections - Learners acquire information and recognize the
distinctive viewpoints that are only available through American Sign Language and Deaf culture.

4EE4A1391BB542BEB424413BB0A8794F.description:
I am able to either state or present drawing from the sources from other
disciplines to discuss about a topic in class.

E2A6CB6F79994E109E75E345DC4E1C22.description:
I can synthesize and evaluate information obtained in other disciplines
to enhance my understanding of ASL and Deaf culture.

7C662A3C813C43D095495051950FF152.description:
I can use ASL to provide information on the work and knowledge of professionals
in their field of study and professions.

482A3CCE758A4387A9B6B49BF7A42A10.description:
I can exchange, support, and discuss their opinions and personal
perspectives in presentations or in class discussions on a variety of topics being
studied in other courses.

F147EADB66234CC8974DE45773F89F19.description:
I can discuss topics in ASL from other subjects, including concepts and issues in
the humanities, sciences, and technology.

CA38EDA7FDE84242A9459BDDC1074260.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can access and evaluate in-depth information and perspectives
that are available through the ASL and its culture.

0B20B42B8B8547BD911E122143CF62FD.description:
Acquiring Information and Diverse Perspectives - Learners reinforce and
further their knowledge of other disciplines through American Sign Language.

CC2B79DD075C4E66B86B944AE3E03340.description:
Connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in
order to use the language to function academic and career-related situations.

77F6A7DCB7984812A56109B379BCBE83.description:
I can investigate and present social, political, and cultural issues discussed
at various Deaf-related forums, internet sites, chat rooms, vlogs, and blogs.

C33A3798C77E477DB5A7A785162447AF.description:
I can analyze and explain patterns of ASL use and linguistic expressions
used by Deaf people and analyze the context and historical usage of some of these
expressions to identify Deaf people’s thoughts and perspectives.

3A9A55716645431F8D1B4BE686C9FE05.description:
I can analyze, synthesize, and present themes of oppression and
empowerment in products of Deaf culture such as stories, poetry, art, and literature and
how they reflect the experiences and perspectives of Deaf people.

AF9C1AD3A6214F18AA44C1FBB2C834B4.description:
I can present my experiences by participating appropriately in discussions with
native signers about literary, social, economic, and political topics.

E58A8467F0884CFD9FD8E2B39E7447BD.description:
I can identify and explain the “unwritten rules” of cultural behaviors of Deaf
people.

CF43C6643E014CA3974140109A5D23A8.description:
I can discuss by comparing and contrasting the private and public life of
Deaf people as they view and interpret authentic materials.

D496D8BEC5B84AC1AC17AB946926BFE2.description:
I can employ critical thinking in identifying and analyzing films,
commercials or documentaries about Deaf people and evaluate the cultural patterns
and social behaviors they demonstrate.

41B4B6CEE2E948A484B05B386A12EE06.description:
I can analyze and discuss on expressive products of Deaf culture, such as
stories, poetry, art, and literature, and explore the ways these products depict the lifestyles
and the diverse perspectives of Deaf people.

2D7D926CFEA843B59F019AAEAEEF245C.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - In my own words and other cultures, I can explain some diversity
among products and practices and how it relates to perspectives in the Deaf culture and community.

0B62823ED4AA42D88C832BF2CFFDD970.description:
Relating Cultural Practices and Products to Perspectives (Investigate)-
Learners provide an explanation of the relationship between the products and perspectives of American
Deaf culture.

63609100D5C043C88534046BD775A0DD.description:
I can analyze, synthesize, and present contemporary issues for Deaf people, such
as education, employment, audism, linguicism, community traditions, clubs, sports
organizations, and technology, and examine their impact on the Deaf culture.

4BF4ADB5354D4EC7854CE1B6198D73EA.description:
I can examine and present major elements of the Deaf culture, such as
concepts of time, personal space, and exchanging personal information, and analyze how
people from other cultures perceive them.

9E7CB746A0C94E648EA96F925DA1DF61.description:
I can analyze changes in the Deaf community and the impact of technology
and telecommunication on the practices of the young generation of Deaf people, and their
influences on young Deaf people’s perceptions and beliefs.

D7327BEC0F9D4884A518AE5D36B2324E.description:
I can discuss perceptions of various Deaf sub-groups related to their cultural and
self identification, stages of acculturation, and their contributions to Deaf culture at
large.

32367EB7ED5E4DF8B9ED3C204608541F.description:
I can examine the cultural value of cooperation used to meet the needs of Deaf
community members through local and national organizations established for, and run by, Deaf
leaders.

819B9F6BC2B446DBAB0D24AA33CD4F2C.description:
Students identify, analyze, and discuss patterns of behaviors and/or
interaction in the context of Deaf culture.

32C61BB3C0164181BF0EB528933DF88D.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can interact at a competent level in familiar and some unfamiliar
contexts.

40D1FC68F576415FBE418FE42EA07758.description:
Relating to Other Cultures by Interacting - Learners provide an explanation of
the relationship between the practices and perspectives of American Deaf culture.

B107589B89424498B7BE6C801FE8F315.description: Interact with cultural competence and understanding.

D7B4489480A9473086AB3455249C4485.description:
I can present the latest research findings on topics related to ASL
linguistics.

8A9F6A8E4014497FA727C2B35E5573E4.description:
I can use resources available in ASL on the Internet, library, and other media
sources to build support for personal opinions and present them.

3BA5556BC22A432ABFA095339E77A939.description:
I can give presentations in ASL on research based investigations of current
events from the perspectives of sub-groups within the Deaf community.

7DA5B31EF9504C7D9DBD9C4EC4F8F9F6.description:
I can select and analyze expressive Deaf culture products presented in
various literary genres or the fine arts.

19FA6822B8CB4E698439924ED00FA48E.description:
I can summarize and record the content of a vlog or documentary intended for ASL
native users in order to discuss the topics with other learners of ASL.

81042411F87F4EA48B143C7009A7F277.description: I can create stories, skits, and plays and perform them for an audience.

2698E959B2CE465DB34F600C4EE7A060.description:
I can present results of a survey conducted on topics of personal interest or
pertaining to the Deaf community.

04EDBFA8D29741A7A25C876265F95F1E.description:
I can prepare research-based reports in ASL on current cultural events relevant to
the Deaf community.

A88DEEDB34E14254B953AA8730BD62C8.description:
I can analyze the nuances of body part classifiers and incorporate a range of
perspectives to suit the message.

DB9E696E15E340D4BEEDCC891100A7A4.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can deliver detailed and organized presentations on familiar as
well as unfamiliar topics, in narratives using advanced storytelling techniques in ASL.

836F0A05E42C4EDC8B280BF3F8407913.description:
Presentational: Students present information, concepts, and ideas to an
audience of viewers in American Sign Language.

317A8C33A7074EE6830EF5925CB7B2C1.description:
I can identify, analyze, and use advanced discourse styles and
strategies that accompany heated, controversial, and sensitive topics.

9CC8B51E81444826B5C4F2759D49A838.description:
I can analyze and explain the nuances of meaning in live and
recorded communication in formal and informal settings.

1B54AE8911AE49319D475754682D9B8A.description:
I can synthesize and present the principle elements of nonfiction topics from recorded materials of current and historical importance to the members in the
Deaf community.

959143B9F6D147DF8CF8085958D781C2.description:
I can analyze variety in sign styles in live and recorded materials and to
understand their significance.

F206EBB0E5D44EB8A1337A84D08D0952.description:
I can analyze, synthesize, and discuss major topics, themes, and
techniques of art created by Deaf Artists and the significance of each aspect.

89A4F01539CE4ECDB5FF4FD254643965.description:
I can analyze, synthesize, and discuss the main ideas and details of
live or recorded discussions concerning current events in the Deaf community, and
subjects studied in other classes.

4733A73BE2644424887D556BC5960536.description:
I can discuss more complex meanings of unfamiliar vocabulary and
grammatical structures through context.

876FD8683ADD4F5891DA27FA4D93001D.description:
I can discuss the main ideas and details of live or recorded discussions
concerning current events in the Deaf community, and subjects studied in other classes.

D46E1EBBEC2148AB971AC6A864AE9DBD.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can interpret the message and supporting details on a wide
variety of familiar and general interest topics across a variety of ASL literature.

3265892ABC66476FA156736BBEB7B3EA.description:
Interpretive: Learners comprehend and interpret live and recorded American
Sign Language on a variety of topics.

C8265E1CC20D4545BC653084D5705E4E.description:
I can discuss the possible ways Deaf people may appear in their professional careers, and
brainstorm how ASL proficiency can be beneficial.

9915882925524040A23B0C159F422C82.description:
I can analyze, synthesize and present the concept of Deafhood based on the life experience
and identity as Deaf individuals.

E808382BDD6541D78352ABDE9238E984.description:
I can exchange and discuss their opinions and personal perspectives with ASL users on a
variety of topics dealing with contemporary issues and historical topics.

96A38522FBC741A8A81CDFC93D0B3936.description:
I can provide my reactions to ASL literature and analyze recurring themes and topics in
poems, plays, narratives, jokes, and stories that have been handed down from generation to generation.

B7E7385F2736455886A30FE0EBEEC7A5.description: I can explain on the impact of audism and linguicism in the Deaf community.

6F8F0DA1E75E4610AE37BBFFEB7336DF.description: I can discuss the key topics in Deaf culture.

A69DD292A2FE49ECB9DF02A54D2B5B79.description:
I will work with a local organizations to participate in an event for the deaf that is
open to the public.

A3B74C75EDC243A3B7F9F391AC7B6A0E.description:
I can discuss ASL sociolinguistic elements such as regional signs, racial and
ethnic sign variation, and gender influences on sign style in a variety of contexts.

3475F5C5C12D477AA170C48EA43712C5.description:
I can discuss and develop possible responses to the pathological view of being
Deaf.

717B91C60B46495CB519C138D62816B4.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Advanced - I can understand the main messages and supporting details on a
wide variety of familiar and general interest topics across various time frames from complex, organized
texts in ASL.

B131BF4E173647419FF24C59E25C1937.description:
Interpersonal: Learners use American Sign Language to engage in conversation
provide information, express feelings and emotions, and exchange opinions.

6EE663A55ABE46A4B6D234E6534C9129.description:
Communicate effectively in more than one language in order to function in a
variety of situations and for multiple purposes.
